The `-cacert` option in `hdiutil` is used to specify the path to a file containing one or more CA (Certificate Authority) certificates to use when creating a signed disk image. It can be used to specify the root CA certificate that the image should be signed with.

The `-certificate` option is used to specify the path to a file containing a certificate that is used to sign the disk image. This certificate must be signed by one of the CA certificates specified with the `-cacert` option.

In summary, `-cacert` option specifies the root CA certificate that the image should be signed with, while `-certificate` option is used to specify the certificate that is used to sign the disk image, which should be signed by one of the CA certificates specified with the `-cacert` option.

Here is an example of how to use both options together:
```
hdiutil create -srcfolder myfolder -format UDBZ -cacert myCAcert.pem -certificate myCert.pem -o mySignedDisk.dmg
```
This will use the myCAcert.pem as the root certifcate and myCert.pem as the certificate used to sign the disk image.
